comment: Worst and most confusing class I have ever taken. Most of the classes would be him sitting in the back and watching the students talk among themselves, giving zero direction. You don't get graded until the very end either, so no idea how you're doing along the way. If you enjoy talking about yourself and not being taught, sure! Take this guy!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Taking this professor is a toss up. If you enjoy group projects and conversations vs lectures then he's a good fit. I don't think his class relates to MGT very well but if you participate and write solid papers (RELATE EVERYTHING TO YOUR LIFE) then this is a super easy class. Doesn't give grades til the end which is stressful tho. Just participate!
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: 100% do not recommend!! Called me out on the second day of class for not emailing him over drop/add week and had the entire class debate my ethics as to if I belonged in college. Talks in riddles and wont give a straight answer to any question. Group work heavy; if you pick a bad group you're screwed. Save yourself, find a different professor.

An awful professor that spends the entire class preaching his opinions to the class. The entire course consists of certain students attempting to suck up to him in order to get an A. You will learn nothing! No grades till the end of the course and the structure consists of multiple group projects. If you want to learn, avoid him!

Best professor I've ever had. Class is based on discussion about real world issues rather than memorizing MGMT terms. We learn a-lot about ourselves and others in the process. You have to be willing to think "without intellectual shackles" to truly extract value. He has impacted my life beyond academics. You'll be confused at first but trust him!!!

I NEVER LEAVE REVIEWS BUT TRUST ME DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES. I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES. JUST TRUST ME. HIS CLASS HAS NOTHING RELATED TO MANAGEMENT AND HE WANTS YOU TO THINK SO ANALYTICAL ABOUT EVERY SINGLE THING ITS DRAINING. AND HE EXPECTS LIKE 10 PAGE PAPERS...I WISH I NEVER TOOK HIS CLASS. TRUST ME DO NOT TAKE HIM
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Does not grade anything until the last day grades are due because "you don't get value out of the class if you are just in it for the grade". A lot of group assignments/presentations so pick a good one. The answers to everything are: relationships and trust (trust me). No book needed, not bad class, just the grades thing sucks.

This class is very philosophical and has no real direction. This class seemed fine at first, but then you realize you have no grades and have no idea how you are actually doing. I went to every class, & I always receive A's but somehow I got a B in this class with no grades to back it up.

Dr. Herbert is an amazing professor & by far my favorite. Our class basically grew into a family over the semester. He doesn't teach in a traditional manner. There are no tests or quizzes. You have mini group assignments each week but they're super easy. He doesn't grade anything until the very end of the semester. You will love this class.

At first I was uneasy about taking Professor Herbert, but I'm glad I did because I have never taken a class like this before. You won't regret it if you take him. The group discussions are amazing and the value you take from this class is something you won't take from a regular class. I highly recommend anyone to take his class.

DR. Herbert's MGT 4001 class was one of the best classes I have taken at KSU. You will form relationships that you never expected to make and you will learn how to abstract value from the topics he discusses. Come to class ready to talk, stay off your phone, seek out great group members on day 1 & forget about knowing ur grade until the last day :)

I'm not the one to rate professors, but this one is a special case. Dr Herbert is the best professor i have ever taken my entire college career(I graduate in 1 month).  If you truly want your eyes opened, take Dr Herbert. If you want an the usual basic class where you spend hours studying for exams, do not take him. He does not believe in grades.

If you are someone who likes structure and letter grades, do not take professor Herbert. You will have no idea how you stand in the class until you get your final grade. Make sure to pick a good group, you're stuck with them all semester. Make sure to speak up during class and come to all classes or you have no chance of making an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I've never rated a professor before, however, Dr. Herbert is worth taking the time to rate. Never have I ever had a better professor. He is amazingly inspirational, he gets you thinking and he gets you thinking in the best of ways. Anyone who has rated him poorly was expecting another class to sleep through. Take him, it's worth it. I promise.
Gives out stupid amounts of work and gives no feedback to how you are doing in class. And the one puzzle project he gives out has already eaten up 10+hours of my life and i am still not done.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Herbert is a gem. He was what education should look like. He doesn't teach you via lecture. His class is more of a self-discovery class and it's great. I learned more about life and business in his class than any other course at KSU. Take him and you won't regret it.

Proffesor Herbert is an exellent teacher that I highly praise as a mentor and life coach. He is fair when grades are due;Just make sure to pay attention, participate in class, attend most classes if possible, give him a psychologically deep answers and  show him that you are making an effort and you will do great in this class.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You'll learn more about yourself than any "management" material. It's not a tough class, but it's an intense one. Pay attention when he speaks. Don't be on your phone or late or break eye contact or he WILL call you out. It's not a normal class setting, and I loved the way he taught. He's very kind, just give him his due respect and you'll be fine.

this class is different, very different. it's that class you remember long after you graduate. it'll be nothing like any of your other business classes and you'll be thankful for his class structure when it's all said and done. if you survive the first week, you'll survive the whole journey. I promise!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Horrible. There is no direction in this class. Every day he comes into class with no agenda and bases the ENTIRE class on some trivial topic that does not pertain to MGT whatsoever. You can tell he loves what he does but he is "teaching" the wrong subject. Feels like a sociology class. Grades based on his opinion & wont post grades till end of sem

Honestly this is a class that I won't forget. There are a few professors that I have had at KSU that have actually taught me something that I think about regularly at my job and this is one of those rare professors. Your grade will reflect how much you care, so be sure to care.

No tests but don't let that fool u. Papers assigned & due each week. Make sure u choose a great group because they are the people u will be writing papers with. Class is not straightforward, meaning a lot of thinking is required. There are no grades, just feedback from your group. He does not lecture which keeps u interested in class discussions

Since an organization is built around people, Prof Herb puts emphasis on people and how they (and you) work as a person. There is group work so choose wisely, he does not give grades on assignments, and the class dynamic is interesting. There is a method to the madness (he did get his Phd from Yale sooo..) so get ready to have your mind expanded.

Dr. Herbert is interesting. This is more of psychology class than anything, and seemed like the class should be call "Organizational Behavior" rather than "Managing Organizations". Regardless, be prepared to throw your shyness in the trashcan. He calls you out. Find a great group that is willing to work hard, and meet up. Speak up in class for an A

Professor wants you to think and be analytical. Most of the lecture is based on psychology and finding out what kind of person you are and how you would fit into a business organization. If you are just looking to show up and take notes do not take him. If you want to grow and learn team building he will not "waist your time"

James Herbert is not for weak students seeking an easy grade. He is purposefully vague so you can learn to grow. His favorite phrase "take the handcuffs off" will explain it all. Be ready to think outside the box and you will have fun with this class. If you need spoonfeeding go elsewhere. I feel like a better person after.  I would take him again

I took the class a little while back. We watched movies and discussed them. It was easy if you showed up. However, I didn't really get anything out of the class. He seemed a bit sanctimous. It was almost as if he was more concerned about changing your perspective rather then teaching. Which may work on younger inexperienced students, but not adults

This class was confusing, frustrating and time consuming. The professor gives no direction for any of the assignments so you have almost no idea what you are expected to do. In addition, you will not receive a grade until the day the final grade is due. You will write at leas 1-2 papers a week and other random assignments with no rubric of what to.

If you want to learn about entrepreneurship, this is the place to be. I've met life long friends in this course, learned skills that I still use to this day in my own venture, and have an adviser for life because of the effort I put into this class. Is it hard? Yes. But if you think starting a business is easy, you're in for a rude awakening. 1110

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! Psychology graduate teaching business. Does not give grades, answer question and projects are unclear. I've attended all but one lecture and I couldn't tell you what I've learned. Assigns last minute assignments that are not in the syllabus almost every week. If you have to take, GOOD LUCK!

Professor Herbert sees college as a place to not just learn theory and what business might be like, but for students to experience real life with business. Most students do not like this professor because he does not simply lecture the answers, give a test, and grade it. If you actually want to learn practical skills in business, take this class.

Do not take this teacher if you value your time and like to know expectations in the class. This teacher will say he is not going to teach you. It is true. He won't teach anything. You must teach yourself. He will never give you anything that is graded bc he gives the grade based on how much food you bring and reverence to him you show. Fire him!

Doesn't actually teach at all, but makes you use what you've learned so far in business school to do it yourself. The whole semester is a group project creating a business that's presented at the end in front of a panel. We also had to bring in guest speakers - something I strongly believe should be his responsibility.  Learned a lot but it sucked.

I was really looking forward to this class, but it was CRAZY!  You can learn a lot (but NOT from the Prof.) and get a good grade.  Pay attention, and follow any instruction he gives specifically.  Bring food to EVERY presentation your group gives.  Pay attention during others presentations.  It's not that bad, but it is a lot of work.

You earn the grade based on how much you get out of the class.  He gives many opportunities to let him know that you are taking something out of the discussions.  He takes note through out the semester and always makes sure you are paying attention. If you let him, he will positively affect your management thinking in both work and life.

Well, don't believe everything you read. He's not that bad. At first you have to get used to him, but once you do you start to enjoy class and you really learn a lot. You have to look in yourself to really achieve balance in your work life. That's all. Now, he doesn't give back papers, but ask him for your grade and his assis. will post it on vista

You spend all of your time on a group project that may or may not be related to the business you want to get into. He is unclear on what he wants, but will tell you how wrong you are as soon you do something that doesn't please him. He answers most questions with "you have resources available to you to for that" instead of answering the question.

NOT WORTH IT! Not what it seems - I learned a lot about business, myself, teamwork, etc. However, none of that learning took place in the classroom. Be VERY careful about choosing your team members and be sure to submit a QUALITY project with ALL bases covered if you do not want to get REEMED in the presentation. Be prepared to spend a TON of $!

Entreprenurship:  He acts more as a mentor than a teacher.  No lectures, but you get out of the class what you put into it.  Not an overly energetic "go seize the world!" rah rah type, but he guides the class and makes it enjoyable.  You'll have killer deliverables and the presentations are expected to be very professional. A very high bar.

This man is so crazy my fingers shake as I write this. The whole semester we only had lecturers that we had to bring in as groups. He never taught, never answered questions, but boy was he quick to look down his glasses at u if u did something he didn't like. I hated him so much I changed majors. He IS an embarassment to Kennesaw as a whole.
This class is an embarrassment to the MBA program.  Prof never lectured, we watched a movie each week and ate pizza.  Does not return assignments, no grades, says you should now how you are doing.

Refers to himself as a "facilitator", not a teacher.  Requires attendance and assigns lengthy papers that are due every other week for the entire semester.  However, he never grades, nor returns, these papers.  The required textbook is never use
No Comments
No Comments
Not a real informative class.
Gave lecture hours away to guests that students brought in. I learned nothing.
